intro: Cestrum anagyridium, commonly known as the white cestrum, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshade plants, and is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers, which bloom in clusters, are predominantly white or pale pink and attract various pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees.
